title: Route Development Manager (f/m/d) bei Flughafen Wien AG | karriere.at
text:
Route Development Manager (f/m/d) Du bewirbst Dich bei dieser Firma am Flughafen Wien:
Flughafen Wien AG (FWAG) Wir über uns Become part of the future - we are taking off again! In our role as Vienna Airport, we are an important hub between Western and Eastern Europe and a gateway to the world. Aviation is a dynamic sector and links cities, continents and above all people. All our employees in the different business areas contribute to ensuring that processes at the airport run smoothly. The Skytrax award “Best Airport Staff” which we as Vienna Airport have won multiple times proves that we are good in this. Do you also want to contribute to our overall success and experience the “fascination of the airport”? The candidate is key in delivering sustainable aviation business development by increasing routes, capacity and traffic at the airport. The objective is to maximize Aeronautical Revenues for Vienna Airport by developing the number of offered seats through the development of new and existing routes. The candidate must be passionate and interested in the long-term success of the airport and thrives in a business development role. The role requires strong airline business insights in identifying, analysing, attracting new route development opportunities and increasing the existing route network. Aufgaben This role will report to and support the Head of Aviation Development in the identification of new route/market opportunities and in converting these opportunities into sustainable and viable routes and services for Vienna Airport. A particular focus of this role will be in developing and analysing market data and intelligence to support route development. Determine, negotiate and secure new route opportunities and build relationships with airlines in Middle East, Africa, Eastern Europe and South Asia (passenger and cargo) Increase connectivity from existing and new accounts to achieve growth targets of Vienna Airport Airline Relationship Management Identify, analyse and develop new route opportunities and attract new routes and airlines (passenger and cargo) to Vienna Airport Source and secure route opportunities through high level negotiations with airlines across Middle East, Africa, Eastern Europe and South Asia Understand and track airlines’ key strategies to identify opportunities for Vienna Airport, as well as other industry trends Proactively build and maintain strong working relationship with new and existing airlines and third parties (regions, tourism authorities, other airports, etc.) and deliver compelling business cases for presentation to airline executives Represent Vienna Airport at aviation exhibitions and events, with the view of bringing in new opportunities Manage and develop existing commercial relationships with airlines (e.g., marketing cooperations) Complete and maintain contractual agreements with various airlines Profil Have experience of working within a challenging commercial environment and will be able to demonstrate a high level of accuracy and attention to detail in their work Have a proven track record in airline industry/airport business Good analytical, negotiation and organisational skills Confident and able to work under pressure, handle numerous parallel activities, time management skills Effective communication and relationship management skills Experience in proactively building and maintaining relationships across the globe Excellent English skills, both written and verbal Ability to work in Vienna The ability to potentially work non-traditional hours International travel will be required as part of this role on a regular basis The role requires excellent interpersonal and analytical skills, the Route Development manager is advising closely the Management team at Vienna Airport Professional working profiency in German Ausbildung Completed university or college degree/Bachelor’s degree in marketing, international business, finance/economics, aviation management or a related field Was wir bieten An interesting, fascinating and multifaceted workplace 5 aditional free/vacation days Free parking and free use of the City Airport Train Lunch allowance Flexitime model Possibility to work from home A gross monthly salary of € 3.775,64 € (negotiable) Interesse geweckt? The collective agreement for employees at public airports in Austria shall apply. If you have any questions on the application process, please contact the Human Ressources Department: t.tischler@viennaairport.com Jetzt bewerben Für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen 6 Wochen Urlaub Richtig gelesen. bei uns gibt es 6 Wochen Urlaub statt 5. Das kann man schon mal gut finden (wir tun es). :-) Anspruch auf einen dividendenabhängigen Ertrag Die Mitarbeiter:innen der Flughafen Wien AG sind über eine Mitarbeiterstiftung zu 10% am Unternehmen beteiligt. Nach einem Kalenderjahr haben Mitarbeiter:innen Anspruch auf einen dividendenabhängigen Ertrag. Attraktive und flexible Teilzeitmodelle In vielen Bereichen bieten wir flexible Teilzeitmodelle, wir finden für jeden das passende Arbeitszeitmodell. Coaching, Beratung durch externes Partnerunternehmen Manchmal läuft es nicht so wie man es gerne hätte. Berufliche Fragestellungen oder private Probleme. Oft reicht schon ein offenes Ohr und ein verständnisvolles Zuhören. Externe Coaches helfen dabei, den Kopf wieder frei zu bekommen und geben Unterstützung – und vor allem – eine Sicht von außen. Dieses Angebot stellen wir kostenlos und anonym zur Verfügung. Essenszuschüsse Mitarbeiter:innen erhalten von der Flughafen Wien AG einen Zuschuss und können diesen zur Verköstigung in zahlreichen Restaurants am Standort einlösen. Fitnessstudio am Standort Beim Flughafen Fitness Studio stehen vergünstigte Konditionen zur Verfügung. Gleitzeit Macht es möglich die Arbeitszeit flexibel einzuteilen. (abhängig vom Tätigkeitsbereich) Home Office Flexibles Arbeiten ist auch am Flughafen Wien wichtig. Daher stehen Mitarbeiter:innen Home Office Modelle zur Verfügung (abhängig vom Tätigkeitsbereich). Impfaktionen Am Flughafen Wien werden für Mitarbeiter:innen regelmäßig Impfaktionen angeboten (z.B. COVID, Grippe oder FSME). Kinderbetreuung Die Flughafen Wien AG betreibt einen eigenen Kindergarten mit hervorragenden Öffnungszeiten. Dieses Angebot wird von unseren Mitarbeiter:innen sehr geschätzt und gerne genutzt. Kostenloser Parkplatz Allen Mitarbeiter:innen steht ein gratis Freiluftparkplatz am Flughafen Wien Gelände zur Verfügung. Kostenloser Werkverkehr mit CAT Mitarbeiter:innen der Flughafen Wien AG haben die Möglichkeit den City Airport Train (CAT) kostenlos als Werksverkehrsmittel zu nutzen. Kostenloser Werkverkehr von Vienna Airport Lines Die Vienna Airport Lines (Buslinie Wien-Flughafen Wien) steht Mitarbeiter:innen kostenlos zur Verfügung. MitarbeiterInnen-Veranstaltungen Informations- oder Erfahrungsaustausch ist uns besonders wichtig. Regelmäßig finden Veranstaltungen für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen statt. Angefangen mit unserer "Willkommen an Board" heißen wir unsere neuen Kolleg:innen herzlich willkommen.
Direkten Kontakt mit unseren Vorständen ermöglicht die Veranstaltung „Nachgefragt“ - selbstverständlich feiern wir auch gemeinsame Erfolge bei unserem jährlichen Mitarbeiterfest. Bei einer Weihnachtsfeier lassen wir das Jahr gemeinsam ausklingen. Papamonat Jeder Papa bekommt seinen Papamonat. Sabbatical Wir ermöglichen unseren Mitarbeiter:innen Sabbaticals in Anspruch zu nehmen. Sport- und Kulturverein Im Flughafen Wien eigenen Kultur- und Sportverein gibt es von Bogenschießen über Segeln und Go-Kart (uvm ;-)) zahlreiche Möglichkeiten um neben der Arbeit sportlich aktiv zu werden. Uniform Wenn für die Tätigkeit eine Uniform vorgesehen ist, wird diese selbstverständlich vom Flughafen Wien zur Verfügung gestellt. Vergünstigungen bei Shops und Gastro am Flughafen Wien Mitarbeiter:innen haben die Möglichkeit gegen Vorlage ihres VIE Ausweises vergünstigt am Flughafen Wien einzukaufen und essen zu gehen. Vielfältige Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten Aus- und Weiterbildung wird am Flughafen groß geschrieben.
Egal ob fachspezifische Ausbildungen, persönlichkeitsbildene Trainings oder Führungskräfteentwicklungen, wir finden die passende Aus- und Weiterbildung für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen. Im Rahmen von unserem internen "Airport-Know-how" können Mitarbeiter:innen andere Bereiche und Kolleg:innen kennenlernen, sich vernetzen und über den Tellerrand blicken.

title: Vertriebsspezialist im Innendienst (m/w/d) bei Toyota Kreditbank GmbH | karriere.at
text:
Suzuki Finance – Ein Geschäftsbereich der Toyota Kreditbank GmbH Zweigniederlassung Österreich - ist seit Jahresbeginn der Kooperationspartner von Suzuki in Österreich. Die neue Kooperation umfasst alle Geschäftsbereiche einer modernen Autobank. In der neuen Geschäftsstelle bei Suzuki Austria in Salzburg werden alle für Händler und Kunden relevanten Geschäftsvorfälle vor Ort abgewickelt. Begeistert dich der Gedanke eine neue Finanzierungssparte bei einer Autobank mit aufzubauen?
Möchtest du Teil des jungen Teams sein, welches die Kooperation erfolgreich gestaltet?
Hast du die Hands-on-Mentalität, die eine solche Geschäftsgründung braucht? Dann suchen wir dich als Vertriebsspezialist im Innendienst (m/w/d) Voll- oder Teilzeit Folgende Aufgaben erwarten dich: 	Unterstützen der Suzuki-Händler sowie des eigenen Außendienstes in alle vertriebsrelevanten Themen
	Koordinieren der einzelnen Fachbereiche für eine rasche und erfolgreich Umsetzung der Absatzförderungsprogramme
	Implementieren der Kampagnen, Finanzierungsprodukte etc. in die POS-Software
	Weiterentwickeln der Absatzförderungsprogramme und des POS-Systems
	Erstellen, analysieren und präsentieren aller relevanten Kennzahlen zur Bewertung der Geschäftsentwicklung der Neuwagen-/ Gebrauchtwagenfinanzierungen durch den Fachbereich Vertrieb & Marketing
	Empfehlen und präsentieren von Maßnahmen wie Konditionsanpassungen, Produktneuerungen bzw. Produktänderungen in den nationalen Gremien Wir erwarten von dir: Betriebswirtschaftliches Studium oder Ausbildung in einer Bank / Leasinggesellschaft
	Berufserfahrung im Vertrieb einer Leasinggesellschaft / Bank mit Schwerpunkt Fahrzeugfinanzierung oder im Vertrieb einer Automobil-Importgesellschaft
	Fähigkeit zur Auswertung sowie Bewertung komplexer Sachverhalte
	Versierter Umgang mit MS-Office
	Sicheres Urteilsvermögen, Verhandlungsgeschick und Durchsetzungsvermögen
	Verantwortliche und entscheidungsbereite Arbeitsweise
	Ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit
	Gute Englischkenntnisse Wir bieten dir: 	Verantwortungsvolle Position in der Geschäftsstelle in Salzburg
	Nationale und internationale Entwicklungsperspektiven
	Sicherer Arbeitsplatz im weltweit erfolgreichen Toyota-Konzern
	Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung (inkl. Home-Office Möglichkeit)
	6 Wochen Jahresurlaub (Kollektivvertrag für Angestellte der Banken und Bankiers)
	Moderner Arbeitsplatz mit Laptop und Smartphone
	Essenszuschuss Für die Position ist ein Jahresbruttogehalt ab € 50.000, - All-in vorgesehen. Entsprechend deiner beruflichen Qualifikation und Erfahrung wird ein marktkonformes Gehalt bezahlt. Sende deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung bitte per Mail an jobs@toyota.at. Ansprechperson: Frau Denise Theuer, BA - Kontakt: +43 676 88726 501 Wir freuen uns auf dich!

title: Bilanzbuchhalter*in bei equi Bilanzbuchhaltung e.U. | karriere.at
text:
Buchhaltung ist nichts für schwache Nerven, aber genau das Richtige für uns. Sind Sie dabei?
gesucht: Bilanzbuchhalter*innen (m/w/d, für Fixanstellung) Als langjährig erfahrenes Unternehmen in Sachen Bilanzbuchhaltung haben wir alle Hände voll zu tunund so einiges zu geben. Mit der ganzen Begeisterungsfähigkeit eines erfolgreichen Teams freuen wiruns auf Ihre Bewerbung - wenn Sie mit uns die Liebe zu korrekten Zahlen teilen, die Freude an gemein-samen Erfolgen und die Souveränität sympathischer Profis. Ihre möglichen Aufgaben bei uns: 	Beratung und Betreuung im Rahmen von Bilanzbuchhaltungsprojekten
	Monats- und Quartals-Reporting nach HGB/UGB und IFRS
	Beratung bei und Einführung von Kostenrechnungsprojekten
	Consulting im Controlling-Bereich für Themen wie Planung, Forecasts und Budgetierung, Optimierung von Controlling-Prozessen, KPIs
	SAP-Beratungsprojekte in Accounting und Controlling
	SAP-Migrationsprojekte auf SAP S/4 Hana
	Digitalisierungsprojekte im Rechnungswesen Was Sie mitbringen sollten: 	mehrjährige Erfahrung als selbstständige*r Buchhalter*in und/oder Bilanz-Buchhalter*in und/oder Controller*in und/oder Unternehmensberater*in
	Spezialkenntnisse in einzelnen Finance-Gebieten (z.B. gute Bilanzierungskenntnisse nach IFRS, US-GAAP, HGB, Kenntnisse in Steuerrecht, Controlling, Kostenrechnung)
	Erfahrung mit unterschiedlichen ERP-Software-Systemen (z.B. SAP R3, SAP S/4 Hana, BMD, Navision, Datev, RZL, Microsoft Axapta)
	idealerweise Erfahrung in Führungspositionen und/oder als Projektleiter*in Rahmenbedingungen für Ihren Einsatz bei uns: 	40 Stunden pro Woche – davon ca. 20 % vor Ort und 80 % remote
	Ihr Gehalt als Angestellte*r für 40 Stunden pro Woche liegt zwischen EUR 4.000,– und EUR 6.000,–, nach Qualifikation.
	Wir arbeiten für Unternehmen in ganz Österreich und in Deutschland. Bei Vor-Ort-Einsätzen sorgen wir für eine kurze Einschulung. Zu rund 80 % kann die Arbeit remote erledigt werden. Was wir gerne für Sie bereitstellen: 	Wir legen Wert auf ein glückliches Team und ein gelebtes Miteinander. Freuen Sie sich auf Events, Ausflüge, Teambuilding und gemeinsame Feiern!
	Bei Vor-Ort-Einsätzen bekommen Sie von uns Essenszuschüsse.
	Etwaige Parkkosten bei Vor-Ort-Einsätzen übernehmen wir für Sie.
	Wir schaffen Möglichkeiten zur Fort- und Weiterbildung für alle, die mit uns arbeiten – ob als Dienst- oder Auftragsnehmer*in.
	Bei Fixanstellung gewähren wir bei längerer Betriebszugehörigkeit die Möglichkeit steuerfreier Mitarbeiter*innen-Beteiligungen. Lassen Sie von sich hören? Mit Lebenslauf und allem? Gerne senden an Frau Victoria Kranner: bewerbung@equi-bilanzbuchhaltung.at Bilanzbuchhaltung e. U. bewerbung@equi-bilanzbuchhaltung.at
1220 Wien, Gisela-Legath-Gasse 5/1

title: Social Banking Development (all genders) - limited contract bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text:
Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself Social Banking Development (all genders) - limited contract Location: Vienna Working-Hours Full-time Occupation Area: Strategy / Research Company: Erste Group Bank AG Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.
Social Banking represents the roots of Erste Group and is a key part of our DNA and business model in all our markets. As one of the leading banks in CEE, we see it as our purpose and responsibility to ensure everyone in our region has access to basic financial products. Within social banking we support starting and micro entrepreneurs to enable job creation. We empower non-profits and social entrepreneurs in their work for our societies and improve the financial stability and inclusion for people on low incomes or in financial difficulties. This function is in charge of coordination and reporting of social banking activities across Erste Group.We are looking for a maternity replacement for a 24-months period. Your Tasks Manages group-wide business, financial and non-financial reporting of social banking as well as reporting to our external partners; defines group standards and supports our units with data quality
Designs and implements impact measurement and reporting of various social banking programmes, coordination of the measurement process across the group and is in charge of data analyses, report preparation and communication
Conveys desk-top research on various topics connected to social banking, supportive EU programs, guarantees and grants; prepares surveys, their processing and evaluation
Organizes on regular bases exchange meetings, plans workshops, off-side meeting, events or conferences
Works with multinational & national non-governmental & governmental cooperation partners for social banking activities in the EG core countries, manages joined projects and the relationships Your Background Completed university studies preferably in economics or social science
At least 2 years of professional experience in reporting or (executive) assistant positions in companies, public institutions or consultancies
Analytical, structural thinking combines with good organization skills and multitasking
Proven practice in research, analytics and writing of papers or articles
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to initiate and drive medium complexity projects
Experience in dealing with different stakeholders, partners in multi-cultural environment
You are a strong team player, flexible, proactive and supportive
Excellent English skills (oral and written), CEE languages and German are an advantage Our Offer Become a key member of Erste Group, an institution which was founded more than 200 years ago, and contribute in a great team to the prosperity of our region
Engage in exciting research and design of banking solutions fighting financial exclusion
Personal development via interacting with diverse counterparties within the bank, public sector, social sector and supranational organizations
Get experience in internationally growing impact finance sector with promising future
Opportunity to shape Erste Group's positioning as regional leader by its direct or indirect positive impact on the environment and society
Be an integral part of a successful high performance team
Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 36.514,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Apply online Follow us:

title: Controller (Purchasing) (m,f,d) bei Zooplus Austria GmbH | karriere.at
text:
Controller (Purchasing) (m,f,d) zooplus SE is Europe’s leading online retailer of pet supplies. With over 8 million active customers in more than 30 European countries and 2 billion Euro revenue in 2022, zooplus is comfortably the market leader in the online segment. zooplus currently employs more than 1200 employees in 10 international locations. As a Purchasing Controller, you support the Purchasing departments in billing retrospectively granted supplier conditions & bonuses, ensuring process excellence, driving compliance, and providing guidance with standard reports to contribute to our financial success. As a deeply service-oriented member of the central Purchase Steering department, you will be tasked with owning, maintaining, and controlling essential financial reports, building insights from supplier conditions, and deriving potentials for improvement in our daily operations. With your profound experience in purchasing controlling and/or purchasing you help Vendor Managers and the Management Board execute the company strategy. Your responsibilities will be: Maintaining, updating, and developing the central supplier off-invoice condition (volume bonuses, marketing bonuses, promotions, etc.) reporting Estimating and tracking expected bonuses for the full year Steering of year-end regarding the achievement of bonuses Clarifying discrepancies in volumes between zooplus and suppliers for the calculation of bonuses Supporting the Purchasing organization and Senior Management in decision-making by providing standard reporting and ensuring process excellence (e.g. retro invoicing) Updating inbound conditions reports to feed into other systems Ensuring tracking, monitoring, and reporting of the development of all the parts in Supplier conditions Designing and implementing projects autonomously in close collaboration with Vendor Management to contribute to efficiency and financial performance Developing new processes jointly with BPO and ensuring cross-departmental standards, compliance, and control of such Collaborate with Vendor Managers and other stakeholders to develop standards for reporting and act as a solution-oriented sparring partner Aim for the best solution for zooplus while communicating and aligning proactively with all relevant stakeholders (Vendor Management, Management Board, BI, Controlling, etc.) Champion stakeholders’ enthusiasm for being data-driven and ensure adherence to best practices and knowledge sharing Requirements Bachelor’s degree in relevant field (e.g. economics, controlling, finance, data analytics, etc.), Master’s preferable with 5 years working experience in (purchasing) controlling, preferably in ecommerce companies; background in consulting is a plus Data-driven – with your strong analytical and problem-solving skills you derive actionable insights for informed decision-making in the purchasing organization Digital native – you possess profound expertise with digital tools (e.g. JIRA, Excel, Tableau, SAP, etc.) Structured and intellectually curious – you enjoy working with data and love improving things as a high-performer Collaborative – you build and maintain positive relationships with colleagues, and enjoy working cross functionally with various teams to gather key inputs Detail-oriented – you possess strong organizational skills, work precisely, and consistently demonstrate a methodical approach to all your work Service-oriented – your proactive attitude and perseverance help you to thrive in a challenging, fast-paced, and international environment with varying ad-hoc projects while working autonomously A critical thinker – you use logic to synthesize critical information, excel at solving complex problems and identify opportunities A strong communicator – you can communicate at all levels with clarity, maturity, and precision both written and verbal. Reliable – you are comfortable with deadlines, competing priorities, and ambiguity in outcomes and organizational lines Fluent in English, German is a plus Our offer Become part of our success story and take advantage of the opportunity for a real challenge in a dynamically growing company with great freedom and short decision-making paths. You can expect versatile tasks in our motivated team with an international orientation and colleagues from all over Europe. In addition, we offer you, amongst other things: 28 labour days of vacation (plus December 24th and 31st) Flexible working hours and the possibility of working partially remotely Modern office in the city center close to Schwedenplatz with a great view over Vienna Discount in our zooplus shop for all our employees  Employee discount program for several online shops German language courses on company premises Free Public Transport Ticket Free drinks and fresh fruit in the office kitchen
	Continuous development through internal and external training opportunities Company events We encourage diversity! Meet our motivated and friendly teammates from over 50 nationalities The gross annual salary for this position (38.5 hours/week) is minimum 50.000 EUR. Depending on your qualification and experience we are willing to overpay. Are you curious?
Then send us your application in English via our online application form. We look forward to hearing from you! Apply for this job

title: Industry Analyst (all genders) for Large Corporates specializing on the Industrials Sector bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text:
Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself Industry Analyst (all genders) for Large Corporates specializing on the Industrials Sector Location: Vienna Working-Hours: Full-time Occupation Area: Corporate banking Company: Erste Group Bank AG Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.
Large Corporates (LC) represents the high performance client coverage team for national and international large corporates clientele within Erste Group Corporates & Capital Markets. The LC Team takes full responsibility for overall relationship management, business origination, global account management and group-wide risk/return for defined client groups with a turnover of EUR 250mn and higher.LC’s client service approach combines sector/industry specialization in the Industrials Sector with regional intelligence and product expertise in order to be in the position to act as a trusted advisor for and to enter into a continuous strategic dialogue with the clients’ decision makers. Your Tasks Direct involvement in front office client facing role and communication with our customers on middle and senior management level (both virtually and physically)
Responsibility for defined tasks and projects along the corporate and investment banking value chain
Work closely with the dynamics of the Industrials sector in order to identify and address client needs along with the ability to build relationships in a professional manner
Play an integral role within the core team & support the day-to-day client relationship management, deal origination and execution
Coordinate and prepare deal origination materials, credit applications and other supporting documents in the course of originating, structuring and executing deals
Conduct fundamental industry research and quantitative analyses, as well as review, monitor and organize financial data
Support the development of the banks’ sector expertise and business incl. knowledge management and internal and external network build-up
Contribute to account planning and target client analysis including evaluation of product use and potential
Evaluate client & deal profitability within the given framework
Cooperate with product specialists, risk managers, colleagues of local banks and other key professionals across the group to ensure information and deal execution efficiency and to foster group collaboration effectiveness
Liaise with the execution management and back office teams in order to ensure smooth and timely implementation of transactions in the bank’s core systems Your Background Bachelor’s degree; Master’s degree is of advantage
Responsible attitude with the ability to act pro-actively in the most reliable and structured manner
Open minded & communicative personality with a sense for sustainable developments
Strong interest in analyzing the financial development of some of Erste Group’s largest clients
Drive, enthusiasm, creativity and excellent interpersonal skills with a motivation to work as a team player in multidisciplinary and cross-cultural transaction teams
Economic and political understanding, robust financial and analytical skill set; corporate finance know-how, financial modelling skills and valuation is a plus
Strong interest in market developments as well as trends in the industrials sector would be an advantage
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and online presentation environments; experience with specific research and analysis tools such as Bloomberg and Capital IQ is of advantage
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills in English and fluency in German Our Offer We enable working in an international and diverse environment with special commitment towards the CEE region
We provide state of the art working facilities at Erste Campus in Vienna
Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 36.514,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Apply online Follow us:

title: Junior Procurement Analyst (m/f/d) bei AGRANA Fruit | karriere.at
text: Junior Procurement Analyst (m/f/d) AGRANA Fruit is part of the AGRANA Beteiligungs-AG, operating at 26 production sites on 5 continents worldwide. We offer a wide range of creative and innovative solutions for the food and beverage industry. Our fruit solutions deliver high quality fruit, which is expertly prepared to be used in the dairy, ice cream, bakery, food service and beverage industries. AGRANA Fruit’s product development work incorporates the latest global nutritional and health trends.We are a great international team, looking for an enthusiastic colleague with passion for Procurement and interest in analytical topics to join us in Vienna in the following position:Junior Procurement AnalystDuration: 12 months, full-time (38.5 hours/week)Working location: ViennaYou are striving for an exciting job, have a passion for procurement and supply chain, are best described by your independent, structured way of working and are ready to be part of a fast-paced working environment? We have been looking for you!The job holder will be on the one hand, taking care of the execution of key operational tasks supporting the Global Procurement Organization (GPO) with reporting and controlling data to enable full transparency on the global sourcing activities. On the other hand, this role builds the interface to IT for purchasing-related projects.Your tasks:You support the implementation and continuous improvement of an objective- and results-driven global purchasing controlling for AGRANA FruitYou perform the monthly procurement divisional report, including analyses for the AGRANA Fruit Management Board and Global Procurement OperationsYou contribute to compiling Volume Tables, Procurement Reports, Monthly Reports and Flash ReportsAdopt measures striving for full data transparency on global procurement activities You support in the development and continuous improvement of procurement performance measurements (KPIs, Plan vs. Actuals, opportunity & risk analysis, etc.) You evaluate data consistency and validate deviations with AGRANA Fruit affiliates You administrate the Global Procurement SharePoint SiteSupport the development and the implementation of pricing modelsYou participate in the preparation of global procurement meetingsProvide ad-hoc data and analyses based on procurement dataYou act as interface for the monthly reporting, budgeting and forecasting and support in the budget planning process (developing templates for forecast, budget and 5-year-plan figures for affiliates, collecting appendices, editing data, data analysis, preparation of presentations)Your ideal profile:Ongoing or completed university degree in Business Management, Supply Chain Management or similarInitial experience in purchasing or data analysis/controlling is an advantage Knowledge and passion in Supply Chain and Purchasing, commercial understandingHigh IT affinity - MS Office skills, especially Excel, and SAP (Business Warehouse) is an additional assetIndependent, highly structured and goal-oriented working style, especially in connection with obtaining necessary information from other departmentsYou are an open-minded personality and you like to be involved in an international, culturally diverse environmentExcellent communication skillsAnalytical thinkingOrganized, flexible and resilient team player with a flair for numbers, problem-solving skills and a proactive ’can do’ attitudeAbility to act and communicate in multi-cultural international environmentFluency in English is a prerequisite, any other language especially German, French is an advantageOur offer: Exciting, diverse and challenging tasks that will allow you to get in contact with various internal and external stakeholders within the AGRANA Fruit world A versatile role at the interface to all departments of a global production company – be it sales, finance, production, purchasing, quality, supply chain, etc.A truly international and dynamic work environment (>20 nationalities) in a dynamic and diverse team located in Vienna´s city center close to SchwedenplatzHome Office option up to 50% working time after the onboarding processPersonal development & career opportunities in an international companyModern, state-of-the-art offices and office equipmentAGRANA "Fit Program" offering various sports and health programs, such as yoga or boot camp.Canteen offering a variety of lunch options each day as well as snacks and drinks Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is € 26.813,64 gross p.a. on full-time basis. Willingness to overpayment depending on qualifications and experience.Applications (CV/ letter of motivation) are accepted in EnglishContact Person:Doris ZANGL | HR ManagerFind out more about AGRANA Fruit and also visit us on LinkedIn.As a global company, we are very proud of our diverse workforce and attach great importance to equal opportunity and diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, gender, religion or sexual orientation who is passionate about our company to apply.Have we caught your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your application. JETZT BEWERBEN

title: Assistent:in der Geschäftsführung mit hoher Zahlenaffinität bei f - Personalagentur für Finanzwesen GmbH | karriere.at
text:
Stellen Sie sich bitte vor: Sie kommen morgens in ein wunderschönes, äußerst edles Office, begrüßen höflich Ihre Kolleg:innen, nehmen Platz in Ihrem eigenen Büro, arbeiten eigenverantwortlich mit einer hohen Qualität und viel Sorgfalt Ihre anstehenden Aufgaben ab und sind abends pünktlich wieder zu Hause. Ihnen gefällt diese Vorstellung? Dann bewerben Sie sich als Assistent:in der Geschäftsführung mit hoher Zahlenaffinität Ihr Arbeitsplatz Es erwartet Sie ein gehobenes Umfeld bei einem Unternehmen für Immobilien mit Sitz in der Grazer Innenstadt. Das Unternehmen ist ein stabiler, erfolgreicher Marktführer in seiner Branche. Eine absolut korrekte, seriöse und zuverlässige Arbeitskultur mit hochqualifizierten Mitarbeiter:innen sind neben einem besonders höflichen und respektvollen Umgang sowie gegenseitiger Wertschätzung das Erfolgsrezept des Unternehmens. Freuen Sie sich auf ein eigenes Büro im hochwertigen Interior-Design und auf verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben. Das Bruttomonatsgehalt beträgt zwischen ca. Euro 2.400,00 und Euro 2.800,00 für Vollzeit mit Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung. Ihr tatsächliches Gehalt hängt von Ihrer Vorerfahrung und von Ihrer Qualifikation ab. Ihre Aufgaben Sie bilden die Schnittstelle zwischen dem internen Rechnungswesen und der externen Steuerberatung und arbeiten dabei eng mit der Geschäftsführung zusammen. Ihr Aufgabengebiet umfasst: 	Rechnungsbearbeitung: Rechnungsprüfung, Aufbereitung für die Steuerberatung, Fakturierung
	Mahnwesen und Überwachung der offenen Posten
	Durchführung des internen Rechnungslaufs und des (internationalen) Zahlungsverkehrs
	Erstellung von Dokumenten, Berichte und Präsentationen
	Mitarbeit bei der Liquiditätsplanung
	Allgemeine Bürotätigkeiten (Ablage, Dokumenteverwaltung, Terminplanung, Besprechungsorganisation) Ihr Profil 	Eine äußerst genaue, zahlenaffine und nach Perfektion strebende Arbeitsweise zeichnen Sie aus
Sie agieren professionell, haben sehr gute Umgangsformen und ausgezeichnete Deutschkenntnisse
	Berufserfahrung in der vorbereitenden Buchhaltung, im Zahlungsverkehr oder in der Fakturierung ist von Vorteil
	Sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office (v. a. Excel) runden Ihr Profil ab Wir informieren Sie gerne unverbindlich über unsere ausgeschriebenen Stellen. Unsere Vermittlungstätigkeit ist für Sie selbstverständlich kostenlos. Wir arbeiten im Auftrag von sorgfältig ausgewählten Unternehmen, die Ihnen immer eine Fixanstellung anbieten und als Arbeitgeber durch Seriosität, Zuverlässigkeit und Mitarbeiterorientierung punkten. Interessiert? Dann freue ich mich auf Ihre Bewerbung (Lebenslauf, Dienst-/Zeugnisse) via unsere Website
www.f-personalagentur.com oder per E-Mail unter tanja.hohl@f-personalagentur.com. Für weitere Fragen stehe ich Ihnen unter 0664/58 39 131 gerne zur Verfügung.

Bezirk mit ausgezeichneter Anbindung Das Bruttojahreszielgehalt inkl. Bonus liegt bei € 68.000 ,- mit der Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung bei entsprechender Berufserfahrung und Qualifikation KontaktWir freuen uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und der Referenznummer JN -022023-5936244. Ihre Bewerbung wird an den zuständigen Berater weitergeleitet. Bitte beachten Sie: Um eine schnelle Bearbeitung Ihrer Bewerbung sicherzustellen, bitten wir ausschließlich um Online-Bewerbungen. text: Key Account Manager (w/m/d) Financial Sector / Finanzbranche Referenz-Nr.: JN -022023-5936159 Ort: Vienna Anstellungsart: Permanent FirmenprofilIn Kürze besetzten wir, MICHAEL PAGE, die Position Key Account Manager (w/m/d) Financial Sector für ein führendes europäisches Unternehmen im Bereich Business Solutions mit Schwerpunkt Data & Finance Analytics. title: (Bilanz-)BuchhalterIn mit viel Gestaltungspielraum (m/w/d) bei f - Personalagentur für Finanzwesen GmbH | karriere.at
text:
Selbstständiges Arbeiten, abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben und breite Verantwortung sind das, was Sie suchen? Dann ist diese langfristige Allrounder-Position in einem bodenständigen Umfeld für Sie ideal. Hier behalten Sie den Überblick über alle Finanzthemen und können Ihren Bereich selbst gestalten und weiterentwickeln. (Bilanz-)BuchhalterIn mit viel Gestaltungspielraum (m/w/d) Ihr Arbeitsplatz Dieses stetig wachsende Unternehmen mit Sitz im Süden von Graz besteht bereits seit mehreren Jahrzehnten und erbringt systemrelevante Dienstleistungen im Mobilitätsbereich. Das KMU glänzt durch flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege. Hier sind Sie als Finanz-AllrounderIn in einer operativen Position u. a. für die Buchhaltung, Verrechnung, das Cash Management und die Weiterentwicklung des Finanz- und Rechnungswesens für zwei GmbHs verantwortlich. Es erwarten Sie flexible Arbeitszeiten, auf Wunsch 2 Tage Home-Office/Woche und ein kostenfreier Parkplatz.
Das Gehalt für diese Position ist abhängig von Ihrer Berufserfahrung und Qualifikation und beginnt bei ca. EUR 3.200,00 brutto/Monat (Vollzeit, 38,5 Std.). Das tatsächliche Bruttomonatsgehalt wird individuell mit Ihnen vereinbart und kann höher liegen. Ihre Aufgaben 	komplette laufende Buchhaltung für zwei GmbHs bis zur Rohbilanz (inkl. UVA, ZM)
	ggf. vorbereitende Bilanzierung bzw. Erstellung des Jahresabschlusses (UGB) zusammen mit dem Steuerberater (je nach eigener Qualifikation) laufende Verrechnung an Kunden
	Implementierung und Weiterentwicklung von Abläufen und Systemen im Rechnungswesen
	Erstellen von Analysen und Berichten
	Unterstützung in administrativen Themen
	vertretungsweise (vorbereitende) Personalverrechnung Das bringen Sie mit 	einschlägige Ausbildung (z. B. HAK-Matura, (Bilanz-)Buchhalterprüfung)
mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung in der Buchhaltung sowie zumindest vorbereitender Bilanzierung
	BMD NTCS Kenntnisse von Vorteil
	Kenntnisse in der Personalverrechnung von Vorteil
	hohes Maß an Verlässlichkeit, proaktive und selbstständige Arbeitsweise, ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit Wir informieren Sie gerne unverbindlich über unsere ausgeschriebenen Stellen. Unsere Vermittlungstätigkeit ist für Sie selbstverständlich kostenlos. Wir arbeiten im Auftrag von sorgfältig ausgewählten Unternehmen, die Ihnen immer eine Fixanstellung anbieten und als Arbeitgeber durch Seriosität, Zuverlässigkeit und Mitarbeiterorientierung punkten. Interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung (Lebenslauf, Dienst-/Zeugnisse) via unsere Website www.f-personalagentur.com oder per E-Mail unter Nadja.Klammt@f-personalagentur.com. Für weitere Fragen steht Ihnen Frau Nadja Klammt, MSc, unter 0660 80 59 060 gerne zur Verfügung.

title: Commercial Analyst m/w/d bei globe personal service gmbh | karriere.at
text:
Philip Morris Austria has chosen to do something incredible, by totally transforming its business and building future on
smoke-free products with the power to deliver a smoke-free future. With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So,
wherever you join PMAT, you’ll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to
move your career forward in endlessly different directions!
For the Philip Morris Austria Headquarter located in the 2nd district in Vienna we are seeking: Commercial Analyst m/w/d BUDGET & Capacity Management Oversee & optimize the functional budget, User P&L and drive ROI calculations to ensure the achievement of short and
long term financial goals.
Lead budgeting & forecasting cycles for the function in coordination with the finance teams. Consolidate and challenge
functional departments budgeting and ensure channel commercial plans are reflected in the budget
Monitor & control variances vs. plan, flag deviations, risks & opportunities to department leads and wider functional
management to ensure efficient budget allocation and optimize forecasting accuracies
Initiate and guide the creation of business cases & ROI analysis to drive profitability across channels and touchpoints
and optimize budget effectiveness
Oversee & optimize the functions capacity planning, ensuring effective staffing for incoming initiatives & projects and
well-balanced resource allocation across teams.
Lead capacity planning process within the function to ensure up-to-date staffing and capacity overview towards
functional management and PMO
Update & analyse capacity reports to identify actionable insights and optimization potential as well as future capacity
constraints and opportunities and give recommendations to functional management KPI ANALYSIS Support on KPI analysis with the local sales analyst in the sales planning team
Along with the sales analyst provide analysis & reporting on sales performance, KPIs and commercial initiatives
Monitoring of sales KPIs vs. targets Requirements: >3 years of experience in a similar position
Financial acumen & analytical skills
Ideally experience in resource planning/capacity management
strong stakeholder management & communication skills across hierarchy levels
fluent in English, german is a plus
Strong excel & PPT skills, SAP & power BI is a plus Our Offer: Participate in the greatest Transformation in PMIs history
Seize the opportunity for your career development with a international market leader
Inspiring working environment
Participate in Philip Morris Talent Sourcing Concept
Gross anual salary of at least € 50.000,-
FTE 38,5 Hours per week
Meal vouchers We are looking forward to your application! JETZT BEWERBEN globe personal services GmbH
Michael Geiter
DC Tower – Donau City Straße 7 in 1220 Wien
M: +43 (0) 676 847626380
www.globe.at

title: International eCommerce Specialist bei Red Bull GmbH | karriere.at
text: Full-time	 International eCommerce Specialist Fuschl am See, Austria Apply now Keen to drive Red Bull’s global eCommerce business to the next level? Join us! In this role, you will be responsible to support the development and execution of Red Bull’s Global eCommerce strategy. You will analyse market and channel trends, shopper & customer insights and define new strategies and tactics to expand Red Bull’s eCommerce reach and drive online sales growth. You’ll also provide strategy and insights that enable local markets to deliver our ambition across eCommerce channels. RESPONSIBILITIES Areas that play to your strengths All the responsibilities we'll trust you with: ACCELERATE ONLINE SALES GROWTHAs International eCommerce Specialist you will influence Red Bull eCommerce Global vision and strategy. You’ll support local markets in executing the strategy and solve business challenges, all while activating insights to drive actions that achieve our business objectives. LEAD CROSS-FUNCTIONAL eCOMMERCE TEAMSYou’ll collaborate with international and local market stakeholders across Marketing (Brand and Advertising), Sales, Finance and Operations. You will work especially close with brand marketing and trade marketing to develop superior eContent and drive its execution across platforms and markets while providing guidance and hands-on support to maximize exposure of Red Bull on eCommerce platforms. You’ll identify and lead workstreams to deliver unique solutions that solve business challenges. DEVELOP NEW TOOLS THAT DRIVE THE BUSINESSYou will develop new business tools, as well as maintaining and improving existing ones. You will lead the management of the Perfect Online Store capabilities, alongside cross-functional experts. ANALYZE DATA AND IDENTIFY NEW TRENDSYou’ll analyze market trends and shopper & customer insights to develop recommendations to seize new business opportunities. You’ll be able to develop innovative solutions to address Red Bull’s eCommerce business problems. Experience Your areas of knowledge and expertise That matter most for this role: Minimum 1 year experience working with global brands (FMCG/CPG industry preferred) or market-leading eCommerce players, across sales and marketing eCommerce background is a plus Strong strategic thinking with a hands-on mentality, pragmatic in developing things from scratch and a passion to drive the initiative to the next level Exceptionally strong communicator that excels in translating complex business issues into practical and relevant terms Ability to influence and lead a multitude of internal stakeholders, including senior executive exposure Understanding of cultural differences and ability to communicate effectively in/with international teams Self-motivated, self-directed, flexible and able to work independently Bachelor’s degree in Business or Economics related Excellent command of English. Additional languages are a plus. 20-30 JOIN THE TEAM Got what it takes? In your application we want to see your personal style - what makes you tick and why you think your next opportunity is here with us. Apply now Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is EUR 2,041 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary. As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin.

title: Senior Credit Risk Analyst bei Western Union | karriere.at
text:
Finance Senior Credit Risk Analyst LOCATION: AT – Vienna
TYPE: Full_time
POSTED: November 8, 2022
ID: JR0110670 Apply Senior Credit Risk Analyst – Vienna, Austria Do you have experience in contributing to the credit review and risk assessment of new and existing clients? Would you like to develop your profile in a leading global FinTech business? Join Western Union International Bank as a Senior Credit Risk Analyst. Motivated by our values: purpose driven, globally minded, and trustworthy & respectful We’re a FinTech that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of over 8,000 employees serving 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen. Better is enabled by trust and respect We’ll be looking to you to perform independent credit reviews and risk assessments of customers’ risk profiles to assist with credit decision-making for the region. Your assessments will include looking at potential new clients and an annual review of existing ones as well as permanent or temporary changes to the approved transactions/clients/limits. You will prepare credit reports to assist in credit decision-making on the transactions including contract extensions/rollovers/modifications etc. In this role, you will perform regular customer and branch visits as well as work closely with the Collection team for overdue accounts management. You will also support defining and improving the credit approval standards, templates and tools to ensure their consistent utilization. To be successful in this role you have solid experience in Credit or Risk Management from a banking or financial services organization combined with profound knowledge of payments, banking operations, products, and processes. You are able to work cross-market and cross-function. You are a natural problem solver with a pragmatic approach while interacting with colleagues. Excellent communication skills and analytical thinking make you stand out from the crowd. Western Union International Bank is a licensed credit institution that’s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. We’re a team of 500 people serving customers through EEA, being part of a global WU team. Join us, and let’s connect the world Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. It’s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If you’re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now. We’re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package. We are passionate about our diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams, while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran (U.S.) status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, in accordance with applicable laws. #LI-AB2 We are under legal obligation to indicate the minimum salary, which is EUR 46,129 gross per year for this position. However, our attractive compensation packages follow current market salaries and can therefore be significantly above the indicated minimum salary. Apply

title: Industry Analyst (all genders) for Large Corporates specializing on the Materials Sector bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text:
Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself Industry Analyst (all genders) for Large Corporates specializing on the Materials Sector Location: Vienna Working-Hours: Full-time Occupation Area: Corporate banking Company: Erste Group Bank AG Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment. Large Corporates (LC) represents the high performance client coverage team for national and international large corporates clientele within Erste Group Corporates & Capital Markets. The LC Team takes full responsibility for overall relationship management, business origination, global account management and group-wide risk/return for defined client groups with a turnover of EUR 250mn and higher.LC’s client service approach combines sector/industry specialization in the Materials Sector with regional intelligence and product expertise in order to be in the position to act as a trusted advisor for and to enter into a continuous strategic dialogue with the clients’ decision makers. Your Tasks Direct involvement in front office client facing role and communication with our customers on middle and senior management level (both virtually and physically)
Responsibility for defined tasks and projects along the corporate and investment banking value chain
Work closely with the dynamics of the Materials sector in order to identify and address client needs along with the ability to build relationships in a professional manner
Play an integral role within the core team & support the day-to-day client relationship management, deal origination and execution
Coordinate and prepare deal origination materials, credit applications and other supporting documents in the course of originating, structuring and executing deals
Conduct fundamental industry research and quantitative analyses, as well as review, monitor and organize financial data
Support the development of the banks’ sector expertise and business incl. knowledge management and internal and external network build-up
Contribute to account planning and target client analysis including evaluation of product use and potential
Evaluate client & deal profitability within the given framework
Cooperate with product specialists, risk managers, colleagues of local banks and other key professionals across the group to ensure information and deal execution efficiency and to foster group collaboration effectiveness
Liaise with the execution management and back office teams in order to ensure smooth and timely implementation of transactions in the bank’s core systems Your Background Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree is of advantage
Responsible attitude with the ability to act pro-actively in the most reliable and structured manner
Open minded & communicative personality with a sense for sustainable developments
Strong interest in analyzing the financial development of some of Erste Group’s largest clients
Drive, enthusiasm, creativity and excellent interpersonal skills with a motivation to work as a team player in multidisciplinary and cross-cultural transaction teams
Economic and political understanding, robust financial and analytical skill set, corporate finance know-how, financial modelling skills and valuation is a plus
Strong interest in market developments as well as trends in the materials sector would be an advantage
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and online presentation environments, experience with specific research and analysis tools such as Bloomberg and Capital IQ is of advantage
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills in English and in German Our Offer We enable working in an international and diverse environment with special commitment towards the CEE region
We provide state of the art working facilities at Erste Campus in Vienna
Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 36.514,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Apply online Follow us:

title: Strategic Product Manager (f/m/d) bei PALFINGER | karriere.at
text: PALFINGER STRUCTURAL INSPECTION (PSI) started as one of Austria’s first corporate start-ups and combines the agility of a young start-up with the stability of an established enterprise. Having won several awards and achieved product-market fit, we are now focusing on scaling-up our business and developing the company. Since last year we have been focusing on standardizing and optimizing organizational structures and processes. Simultaneously, we are working in flexible, cross-functional teams to further improve our solutions. We master exploration and exploitation! You love to shape the future based on a new but already proven business model? You see change as a chance and are ready to face the challenge? You want to be part of an outstanding team and are willing to contribute to developing our idea and company further? If your answers are ‘yes’, let’s see how you can be part of our journey and bring in your expertise and energy! We are searching for an experienced, proactive and target-oriented STRUCINSPECT - Strategic Product Manager (f/m/d) PALFINGER STRUCTURAL INSPECTION (PSI) started as one of Austria’s first corporate start-ups and combines the agility of a young start-up with the stability of an established enterprise. Having won several awards and achieved product-market fit, we are now focusing on scaling-up our business and developing the company. Since last year we have been focusing on standardizing and optimizing organizational structures and processes. Simultaneously, we are working in flexible, cross-functional teams to further improve our solutions. We master exploration and exploitation! Our field of expertise involves cutting-edge technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI), cloud technologies and infrastructure lifecycle management, brought together in a B2B platform business. Our vision is to keep the world’s infrastructure safe by taking the billion-dollar market of infrastructure lifecycle management into the digital era.You love to shape the future based on a new but already proven business model? You see change as a chance and are ready to face the challenge? You want to be part of an outstanding team and are willing to contribute to developing our idea and company further? If your answers are ‘yes’, let’s see how you can be part of our journey and bring in your expertise and energy! We are searching for an experienced, proactive and target-oriented Strategic Product Manager. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for the overall success of the PSI product/solution Responsible for the definition, dissemination, and implementation of the overall product vision, strategy and principles of PALFINGER STRUCTURAL INSPECTION Responsible for the development of scalable, profitable and long-term sustainable business models from a niche player to a global technology solution provider Maintain together with marketing Competitive and Market Analysis abreast, constantly monitor market developments/trends in the infrastructure industry and competitive environment Responsible for implementing appropriate governance and reporting as well as for the development of professional portfolio management and controlling Responsible for the PSI product and feature portfolio End2End responsible for product and requirement management for the whole product lifecycle Manage/own a robust roadmap, communicate tailored to various internal and external stakeholder needs Translate market requirements into solutions and product features to enable best product/market fit Orchestrate, initiate and manage the solution development and operation, execute gate reviews with related teams Generate a consolidated overview of the product performance and its key performance indicators,including customer satisfaction, revenue, cost savings, margin, market-share, in close cooperation with Marketing, Sales and Finance, and drive continuous improvements based on learnings. Support establishment of the necessary implementation capacities, sourcing to external technology partners, if necessary Manage internal and external stakeholders Build lasting partnerships, alliances and required development and distribution eco-system Support our solution selling approach with customer-facing pre-sales support, solution design and consulting, as well as trainings and knowledge provisioning Coordinate your strategic activities with PSI Directors and the Expert Advisory Board Strong focus on sustainable growth and impact on the market Develop a pricing strategy and optimize market pricing for our platform services and solutions Ensure a favorable gross margin of the entire product/solution portfolio Identify solution partners and 3rd party service providers to supplement and constantly enhance the solution services offering Build on existing and create new Sales channels and Go-to-Market strategies together with Sales and Marketing. Identify areas of growth and contribute to define the G2M strategy for existing and new target market YOUR QUALIFICATIONS: BSc in a technical field (engineering, computer science, SW-development, business informatics or comparable); MSc/MBA is a plus Proven experience of minimum 5 years in digital product and project management, requirement engineering, development of sales and building winning G2M strategies Strong customer focus, strategist with excellent business acumen, hands-on, turn ideas into reality, demonstrate growth-mindset, start-up /corporate experience a plus Experience in creation, development, and market launch of digital products, scaling business models (SaaS, PaaS) Confident communicator with very good verbal and written communication skills, “bridge builder”, able to leverage capabilities available with excellent organizational and planning skills Ability to persistently pursue one's goals, willing to grow with the challenge, not discouraged by headwinds or setbacks Know how to turn voices of customers into actionable insights and impactful solutions and products, passionate personality with a winning mindset WE OFFER YOU: Performance-related compensation and attractive incentive schemes The opportunity to work in an international business environment with cutting-edge technologies Participation in the scale-up phase of our growing corporate start-up Good work-life-balance thanks to flexible working hours Personal and professional development opportunities Voluntary fringe benefits (e.g., meal allowances, gym discounts, etc.) All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Minimum gross salary according to Austrian metal industry collective agreement is EUR 48.877,36 per year. We are willing to overpay according to training and qualification. We are looking forward to your informative application!

title: Student Job (f/m/x) - Retail Business Performance & Strategy Department (25 h/week) bei Raiffeisen Bank International AG | karriere.at
text: Student Job (f/m/x) - Retail Business Performance & Strategy Department (25 h/week) Retail Business Performance & Strategy Department (RBPS team) runs all steering activities for the business line retail banking within the head office as well as in RBI´s network banks. The team represents the business hub to all other RBI units and is responsible for all internal group directives as well as all external regulations (e.g. MiFID II) affecting retail. It is in charge of the budgeting process, the steering of the retail investment product distribution, Bancassurance as well as retail balance sheet management. Measuring digital sales and digital retail maturity is also covered by the RBPS team. You are an active student and would like to support us on a part-time basis in this waste retail steering area on a group level then keep on reading! #start as soon as possible #part-time (25h / week) #viennaoffice These tasks are waiting for you Assistance with the analysis of data, excel-based and hosted in cloud Understand and explain existing data model to various stakeholders Data preparation and basic analysis in connection with preparation of retail reports Ongoing support and further improvements of the Retail data governance Supporting business team with documenting business requirements Drive communication between various stakeholders across RBI Assisting the project team in various topics (coordination, documentation and tracking of milestones) What you bring to the table Student in Business Informatics, Business Administration, Computer Sciences, Statistics, Economics, or any degree program with an emphasis on finance and/or data Fluency in English You are data-oriented and feel comfortable working with numbers Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills: experienced and fully comfortable with lookup functions, and able to pull and shape data into required form from various raw data sources and files, generate charts and slides from various information and data sources Knowledge in working with databases, database queries (e.g. SQL) and/or data modeling is a plus Ability to create reports in BI tools You like to work in and contribute to a cross-functional team and agile environment Easy-going personality with enough confidence to be able to continuously follow-up with more senior colleagues, drive data delivery, and ensure flow of internal data-related projects What's in it for you? Work & Study: gain experience in the international banking environment & boost the balance of your bank account Flexibility: adapt your working hours to your university schedule Onboarding: enjoy an easy start - a buddy from your team will take you along Community: network internally with other students Canteen: healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized Corporate Benefits: shopping vouchers from the staffs' council (eg. supermarkets), free museum tickets, attractive sports offers, reduced fitness center membership, free public transport pass etc. We pay an attractive monthly student salary of gross EUR 2,049.64 (on a basis of 38.5 hours) Would you like to know what it feels like working for RBI while studying? Check out our videos and see what your future colleagues say about us. At Raiffeisen Bank International, we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people. From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs. For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website our check out our FAQ. Please address your application letter to Christina Stolz.Check out our RBI Account on LinkedIn! Jetzt bewerben

title: Sachbearbeitung Fakturierung und Export (VZ) bei f - Personalagentur für Finanzwesen GmbH | karriere.at
text:
