title: Identity & Access Management Security Engineer (all genders) bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text:
Make a difference in the financial life of millions of people: At Erste Digital you are co-creating the digital future, in which better financial health is possible. #believeinyourself Identity & Access Management Security Engineer (all genders) Location: Vienna Working-Hours Full-time Occupation Area: IT Company: Erste Digital The future of banking is digital, and IT is the key to this change. Erste Digital is the digital enabler that drives innovative IT solutions for Erste Group, the leading banking group in CEE. Our service involves “run the bank” as well as “change the bank” activities. Our more than 2,000 IT experts and enthusiasts deliver best-in-class IT solutions and services to all Erste Group entities and by this directly to Erste Group’s more than 16 million customers. Are you ready to work for one of the most innovative and largest IT companies in the CEE region? Then hit the “apply now” button. Erste Group’s Cyber Defense Center (CDC) provides security services for business partners in Austria and CEE, with a strong focus on protecting IT and data assets. The CDC is performing a broad array of security activities and is responsible for maintaining a secure IT landscape, especially in the digital banking area of Erste. We are now looking for a full time Security Engineer in the field of Identity & Access Management to expand our team of likeminded security experts in terms of maintaining a secure IT landscape and a secure journey to the cloud. A vibrant team and agile, savvy and multifunctional opportunities are waiting for you. Your Challenges You and the team are responsible for configuration and operation of the privileged access management (PAM) infrastructure according to security requirements and best practises
You will analyze, align and propose IAM/PAM improvements and are comfortable implementing and operating the required tools and infrastructure
You will be writing scripts to automate application deployment, access APIs, etc.
You will research latest and future Authentication and Authorisation methodologies and support the design of effective Identity & Access Management (IAM) Architecture
You are going to contribute to the implementation of IAM/PAM technology and processes in cooperation with subject matter experts and developers Your Background You bring an understanding of digital services and their Cyber Security implication You are able to follow Security by Default and Security by Design principles Experience with agile project methodologies is welcome You are open to new challenges and to work in a diverse environment You are a service-, action-oriented and have results-driven personality You understand modern authentication and authorization protocols and their cyber security resilience You are familiar with IT architecture and engineering, and are eager to contribute to (security) operations
Previous experience with CyberArk products is appreciated
Experience with Windows administration, managing IIS, etc. is a plus
Knowledge in digital banking and finance is a plus
An acceptable level of English is required for teamwork, basic skills in German is welcome but not required You will like us, because we offer The opportunity to work in a progressive banking IT area and to develop your own areas of responsibility and to take on responsibility yourself Care, collegial working atmosphere characterized by mutual appreciation, team spirit and fun at work Possibility to benefit and learn from our international, talented and passionate community at Erste Great learning curve through ownership and creative freedom Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there’s something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus
Health Centre – The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health center that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours.
New way of work: With our flexible working hours model we want to make your life less complicated. Combing the best of both worlds, remote and company time.
Employee benefits – Benefit from special conditions for financial services and insurances, supermarkets, clothing stores and many more.
Employee Referral Program – Become a talent scout for career opportunities in IT. We are rewarding every successful referral for Erste Digital
Language courses for German & English – Learning a new language unites. We support you with appropriate language courses where you participate together with your colleagues.
Visa Sponsoring – We support our employees with all the formalities associated with a relocation
Work-Life-Balance – Home office, paternity leave, sabbatical, sports courses -– we support you in balancing work, family and leisure time The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 56.448,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person! Interested? We would like to fill this position as soon as possible - apply now! Apply online Follow us:

title: Trade Promotion Management Consultant bei Red Bull GmbH | karriere.at
text: Full-time	 Trade Promotion Management Consultant Fuschl am See, Austria Apply now The Information Technology Department at the headquarter in Austria manages the global IT agenda of Red Bull. To promote further constant growth, we are looking for an experienced and ambitious SAP Project Manager.You’ll work in an innovative, friendly, and collaborative work environment closely together with your business partners identifying the right solutions and technical architecture for their integrated processes. We together innovate and develop new solutions for our business of tomorrow. Your creative thinking and interest in the latest technology and IT trends in the consumer goods industry help you to master your role in the Red Bull Business Applications team. RESPONSIBILITIES Areas that play to your strengths All the responsibilities we'll trust you with: PROJECT MANAGEMENTYou’ll utilize your existing project management experience in a business application environment. Lead and deliver projects based on Red Bull project management standards and principles. While managing project scopes, budgets, time, and resources of external implementation teams and partners, you’ll run global implementation and rollout projects to the Red Bull subsidiaries worldwide. BUSINESS PARTNERYou’ll understand, challenge, and translate business requirements into a functional scope and technical design. In this supporting role, you’ll help our Sales and Finance departments in any IT Application matters to generate the highest value for the organization. Drive ongoing enhancements and improvements of the Red Bull sales application portfolio. SOLUTION DESIGNYou’ll translate business requirements into technical concepts and steer external teams for implementation. Coordinate IT implementation teams to generate Solution design in a highly integrated, technologically challenging, and innovative environment. You’ll support the transition of Red Bull sales applications to future SAP platforms S/4HANA, C/4, and BW/4. With your expertise, you’ll influence SAP Product Roadmaps through collaboration with Product Management and Development Teams based on industry requirements & best practices. PRODUCT MANAGEMENTYou’ll be a part of a team that has direct interaction with our technology partners’ product management teams. Manage business applications through the full lifecycle of Red Bulls technical product portfolio. Master the definition of governance standards, support concept, and maintenance/enhancement agenda of your applications. Innovate together with our IT vendors on enhancing and evolving their product portfolio to a better fit for Red Bull and the consumer goods industry. Experience Your areas of knowledge and expertise That matter most for this role: 5+ years of professional experience within Project Management or business process domain field (preferable in Consumer Goods Industry) Functional and/or technical skills in SAP CRM, ERP (S/4) or BI Analytical, data-driven profile Excellent communication skills Performance and result oriented & team player University Degree in Computer Science / Business Administration or equal practical experience Very good English language skills (written and spoken), German beneficial 0-10 JOIN THE TEAM Got what it takes? In your application we want to see your personal style - what makes you tick and why you think your next opportunity is here with us. Apply now Due to legal reasons we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is EUR 2.041 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary. As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin.

title: Product Owner - Payments (all genders) bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text:
Working at Erste Group means pursuing a common goal and being enthusiastic about shared values. We always treat one another with respect, empathy, and understanding for our diverse backgrounds. This applies to our customers as well as to our employees. Product Owner - Payments (all genders) Location: Vienna Working-Hours Full-time Occupation Area: Others Company: Erste Group Bank AG Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.
We in Daily Banking Services aim to digitalize all our client back office processes to the core. We want to offer the best digital customer experience, which is seamless, convenient, fast, and compliant.Our unit Payments Services and Clearing is the Group Central Hub responsible for clearing and settlement of payments providing the national and international reach to Erste Group members, savings banks, and foreign subsidiaries.We manage the network relationship with clearing houses and are responsible to steer all payments and settlement relevant operations at Erste Group. Our unit develops the Group payments strategy toward digitalisation in cooperation with business stakeholders, compliance, and IT. We represent Erste Group in national and international bodies and participate in industry working groups. Our unit also acts as the regulatory SPOC for payments towards all internal departments across Erste Group, the supervisor, and auditors. Your Tasks Lead the definition and implementation of new solutions and services for payments in close cooperation with all relevant stakeholders across Erste Group, savings banks and foreign subsidiaries
Keep pace with the dynamic world of payments translating best practices and industry trends into payments initiatives for Erste Group and its customers
Contribute to the digitalization strategy for payments processes and solutions by actively driving digital payments initiatives from ideation to successful delivery
Ensure that, for payments initiatives, success is transparently defined, quantified, and measurable. Be in charge of the budgets, and report to key stakeholders on the strategic impact of the initiatives and achievement of goals
Liaise with business units and other stakeholders across Erste Group and ensure that the new payments solutions and services are adopted by end users
Represent Erste Group in external bodies and working groups with payments focus Your Background At least three years of professional experience in developing payments services and solutions in close cooperation with all stakeholders along the value chain or comparable position in running payments digital initiatives
A university degree (BA or MA) in Economics, Finance, Technology or Science (university or “Fachhochschule”)
You are payments savvy: well-informed about market standards, developments in regulations & digital technologies and their implications for banking and payments
Strong knowledge and understanding of banking services, products and processes with payments focus
You have a strong customer-orientation and strive for high client satisfaction
Demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Act self-accountable; embrace change and act as an enabler
You have a positive, entrepreneurial, and agile mindset, you like to take initiative and accept challenging tasks
Fluent in German, English. CEE language(s) of benefit Our Offer We are a team, who live and breathe continuous improvement & digital transformation; we join forces to achieve common goals and make a positive impact We are open-minded, responsible, supportive, and always ready to go the extra mile for great solutions We care for your personal well-being and career development while actively supporting your educational needs Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group A competitive and performance-related salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications is granted - the minimum wage for this position in accordance with the respective collective agreement is EUR 39.356,-- gross per year Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Apply online Follow us:

title: Part-time Department Coordinator (f/m/d) Department of Network and Data Science bei CEU GmbH – CEU Central European University Private University | karriere.at
text:
Part-time Department Coordinator (f/m/d)
Department of Network and Data Science Starting date: As soon as possible Application deadline: Open until filled Full- or Part-Time: Part-time (20 hours/week) Location: Vienna The Department of Network and Data Science at Central European University (CEU) invites applications for a Part-Time (20 hours/week) Department Coordinator position. Background: The Department of Network and Data Science at Central European University provides an organizational platform for research in network science, with a special focus on applications to practical social problems. The department offers a Master’s program in Social Data Science and a PhD program and an Advance Certificate Program in Network Science. The Department of Network and Data Science translates these ideas into research projects - our faculty have won several major grants, from European Union and US funding agencies. Your duties and responsibilities: 	Administration of the Master’s in Social Data Science teaching program, course enrollment, teaching schedule, theses, calendars, and room assignments
	Daily administrative duties of the department
	General office duties like ordering supplies
	Organizing and maintaining program-related documentation and correspondence, records of relevant meetings, and communications with partners
	Managing agendas, organizing travels and appointments
	Managing and organizing events, receptions, field trips and cultural activities by negotiating with suppliers and vendors, collecting price offers, handling finances, advances, invoices
	Financial duties including budget, invoicing, procurement
	Managing the department’ s website, social media profile and email lists
	Manage payments via SAP and financial forms
	Prepare contract, payroll, and personnel documents for visiting faculty, researchers, and student assistants
	Draft and update departmental policies and procedures Your skills and qualifications: 	Bachelor’s degree (minimum).
	At least 3 years of working experience in a position with similar tasks, ideally in higher education or at an international company.
	A strong interest in working on finance and HR-related tasks in an international environment.
	Excellent communication and writing skills in English.
	Outstanding financial and analytical skills.
	High level computer literacy and advanced knowledge of the MS Office suite and mastery of databases.
	Excellent organizational and reporting skills.
	Ability to work alone and in a team.
	Problem-solving skills.
	Experience in marketing/branding and German language knowledge are considered as advantage.	 What we offer: 	International environment
	Salary supplement for meals
	Employer contributions to Resaver private pension plan
	Family support scheme
	In-house opportunities for job related trainings and workshops We offer a competitive salary starting from gross 42,000 EUR/year (prorated). A higher salary is possible if warranted by the candidate’s working experience. How to apply: Applicants need to submit:
	CV
	Cover letter Please send your complete application package to advert005@ceu.edu: including the job code in the subject line: 2023/005 CEU is strongly committed to the promotion of gender equality and equal opportunities within our institution. Previous training, work experience and/or engagement with matters of equality, diversity and inclusion at the organizational level will be an asset. Central European University does not discriminate on the basis of—including, but not limited to—race, color, national and ethnic origin, religion, gender and sexual orientation in administering its educational policies, admissions policies, employment, scholarship and loan programs, and athletic and other school-administered programs. The privacy of your personal information is very important to us. We collect, use, and store your personal information in accordance with the requirements of the applicable data privacy rules, including specifically the General Data Protection Regulation. To learn more about how we manage your personal data during the recruitment process, please see our Privacy Notice at: https://www.ceu.edu/recruitment-privacy-notice-austria. About CEU Central European University (CEU) is a research-intensive university specializing in the social sciences, humanities, law, public policy and management. It is accredited in the United States, Austria and Hungary. CEU’s mission is to promote academic excellence, state-of-the-art research, research-based teaching and learning and civic engagement, in order to contribute to the development of open societies. CEU offers bachelor's, master’s and doctoral programs and enrolls more than 1,400 students from over 100 countries. The teaching staff consists of resident faculty from over 50 countries and prominent visiting scholars from around the world. The language of instruction is English.
For more information, please visit https://www.ceu.edu/.

title: Trainee Product Application Engineering Automotive High Voltage Discretes (f/m/div)* - International Graduate Program bei Infineon Technologies Austria AG | karriere.at
text:
Trainee Product Application Engineering Automotive High Voltage Discretes (f/m/div)* - International Graduate Program At a glanceAre you ready to start your career in a fast-moving, future-oriented environment? The International Graduate Program (IGP) at Infineon gives you full insight into how we come up with innovations. Our products make the difference … Electrification of cars is a major contribution to hamper global warming and contribute to #decarbonization of our mobility. We develop and manufacture the essential high voltage power electronic products to drive cars and “fuel” other high-voltage systems in electric cars. Quick infoLocationVillachEntry level0-1 yearJob IDHRC0136138StartApr 03, 2023TypeFull timeContractPermanent
Job descriptionJoining the IGP will give you the big picture of Infineon: Over the course of 18 months, you have at least three different assignments – one of them abroad. From the beginning, you’ll have a chance to roll up your sleeves and take on demanding tasks. Besides that, you have the opportunity to build technical skills (learn from our global expert network), establish strong global relationships across sites, functions and departments, and to meet the global IGP community face to face and at virtual conferences. And if that isn’t enough, you’ll have permanent employee status from the start. Within the different assignments, projects and classroom trainings you will build many of the strengths we rely on from leaders in our organizations.You will be an IGP Trainee for Product Application Engineering of our High Voltage (1200V) SiC MOSFET products, which are used in on-board-charger and DCDC converters for electric cars. These power semiconductors are an essential part in those systems. Our customer value our cutting-edge products as well as our technical support. You will help customers to select the right product, technically support simulations, run simulations by your own, to name a few tasks. You will also work in the lab to assess the performance of our SiC MOSFETs in the application. For sure, from the beginning, you will work in a great global team.Your program consists of the following elements: You will start your assignment in Villach, to build technical expertise and contribute to first application engineering activities, such as developing technical promotion material for our upcoming product launches. International assignment of 4 – 8 months either in Asia or the United States to work with our regional Sales, Marketing and Application engineering teams. You will have your first customer engagements. Two assignments in Munich headquarter with concrete project goals, which are fulfilled within the application engineering team for Automotive SiC MOSFETs and high voltage gate drivers. You will support customers to evaluate and design our products and collect feedback which will influences the definition of our future products. Be engaged and contribute to successful product release and go2market activities, such as writing application notes. Help to solve technical problems from the customers with the support of our internal expert network. Be part of a global interdisciplinary expert team consisting of technical marketing, product development, quality, finance, sales and regional marketing. ProfileYou are curious and interested in a broad range of topics and always try to get new insights and ideas. You don’t expect things to be handed to you on a silver platter. You question existing assumptions, put the customer at the heart of your actions and love change – which is guaranteed in the semiconductor industry. You are pragmatic and analytic, because we need both at Infineon. Standing still is not your thing. You find inspiration in working with different kinds of people, collaborating with your colleagues beyond borders on the big picture.Plus, you fulfill the following qualifications: a degree in Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or Industrial Engineering with appropriate technical know-how in power semiconductors already gained some practical experience in application engineering, technical support e.g. through internships during your studies ideally gained a first working experience abroad a methodological and analytical mindset and the ability to understand, summarize and present complex technical topics experience on hands-on-technical lab work with high voltage power semiconductor products, maybe even in context of automotive applications are a plus an affinity for technology and willingness to travel to customers fluent in English with good communication and presentation skills. German as a plus And you fully agree with these statements: I am an ambitious and open-minded person who loves to get to know new people and learn about new topics. When I think about moving to another country for at least three months, I want to start packing my bags. I like to work in teams that are very diverse and in which everyone speaks English. I can’t wait to present a concept to the team and managers – and I don’t mind doing it in English. My friends describe me as “highly independent and self-motivated team player”. If this is you, then we want to make it easy for you to apply:All we need is your CV and your relevant certificates, such as your final university degree or your most recent university transcripts. Convince us with your personality, special skills and experiences.We offer competitive salaries and additional benefits based on your performance, experience and qualification. title: Master Data Manager Customer (m/f/d) bei voestalpine AG | karriere.at
text: Master Data Manager Customer (m/f/d) Job-ID: V000006801 Location: Vienna Start date: as soon as possible Closing date: 02/28/2023 Working Hours: Full-time Introduction voestalpine High Performance Metals GmbH is the parent company of the High Performance Metals Division in the voestalpine Group. We are the global market leader in tool steel and hold leading positions in high-speed steel, valve steel, special engineering steel and other special grades. Customers can rely on our well-established brands that have frequently set the standards for the special steel sector over many decades with their innovation and top quality. The master data management team of the voestalpine High Performance Metals Division plays a central role in long-term successful operation and development of the SAP system and connected systems. The team works closely with various business functions (e.g. procurement, sales, production), IT, finance and controlling on holding and global subsidiaries level to integrate their demands into a consistent and future-proof system. With their active governance role, it ensures both business needs and harmonization and efficiency targets are met. As a Junior Master Data Manager you join the Strategic Marketing & Sales team which works with our global sales network in the Value-Added Service Business Unit to optimize & digitalize the marketing & sales process of our division. You will be part of a team of open-minded colleagues from diverse backgrounds who enjoy driving their joint activities with high ambition and strong target orientation. Please find further information on our website: http://www.voestalpine.com/highperformancemetals/en/ Job description Product owner (m/f/d) of the global customer master data model, customer life cycle management process (including customer creation, maintenance, archiving, etc.) and their dependencies Actively drive the professional maintenance and continuous development of customer master data for SAP, CRM and other connected systems to support business goals Play an active role in standardization and harmonization of customer master data in the division, in close collaboration with business and other functions Proactively monitor master data quality and drive improvement activities with subsidiaries globally Ensure and deliver trainings on customer master data for colleagues (m/f/d) globally Act as expert (m/f/d) for customer master data in the further rollouts of new SAP S4 HANA globally, to integrate existing and new requirements into a consistent solution Disciplinarily Reporting to: Head of CRM, CRM is a unit within Strategic Marketing & Sales Functionally Reporting to: Divisional Master Data Manager Qualifications 3 years of experience in business or IT functions, actively managing SAP, CRM and/or other master data Experience with an MDM Tool is a plus Strong project management skills to take the initiative, coordinate with different stake holders (m/f/d) & make things happen Excellent communication skills, successful management of conflicting interests with multiple functions and ability to find solutions for business requirements collaboratively High service-oriented and getting-things-done mentality towards internal customers (m/f/d) Reliability and diligence, as well as self-organized personality Advanced level of German and English, other languages are beneficial Flexibility to travel globally (up to 15%), possibility for home office up to 2 days a week What we offer Salary Package and Benefits: The collective minimum salary agreement for this position is € 3.491,24 gross (14 x per year). The actual payment depends on the particular qualification and experience. voestalpine offers its workforce an attractive and appreciative working environment: We support with an extensive initial introduction phase, regular on – the – job trainings, flexible working hours and annual appraisal interviews. We enable certain perquisites and benefits for different commercial partners and with a good course of business all employees will be paid an additional annual bonus. Employee participation is of particular importance for us; currently employees of voestalpine hold 14% of the shares. The fact that voestalpine is a globally leading steel and technology group today is primarily thanks to its approximately 50,200 employees. title: Part-Time Department Coordinator (f/m/d) Department of History bei CEU GmbH – CEU Central European University Private University | karriere.at
text:
Part-Time Department Coordinator (f/m/d)
Department of History Starting date: As soon as possible Application deadline: Open until filled Full- or Part-Time: Part-time (20 hours/week) Location: Vienna The Department of History at Central European University (CEU) invites applications for a Part-Time (20 hours/week) Department Coordinator position. Background:
The Department of History offers programs of considerable breadth, on both the Master’s and the Doctoral level, challenging canons by means of thorough empirical research and cutting-edge methodological and theoretical reflection. The Department offers research-driven historical education to train future scholars, academic and public leaders, and professionals with a broad horizon. Its teaching and research focus is on early modern and modern history from the sixteenth century to the present, with a number of regional concentrations, including Central and Eastern Europe as well as the Ottoman and Russian Empires, the Soviet Union, and their successor states, going beyond these geographical and temporal boundaries with a comparative and interdisciplinary perspective. Further information about the department can be found here: https://history.ceu.edu. Your duties and responsibilities: 	Coordinate the department financial activities, accounts payable, travel, purchasing, expenditures.
	Monitor the budget.
	Manage payments via SAP and financial forms.
	Prepare personnel documents for (visiting) faculty, researchers, and student assistants for their employment contracts and payroll.
	Communication with central university administration
	Support the administration of the academic programs (student admissions, course enrollment, administering records, credit and grade entry, data maintenance).
	Perform data collection, analysis and reporting to the Head of Department and faculty, preparing meeting minutes etc.
	Handling day-to-day operation and technical problems. Your skills and qualifications: 	Bachelor’s degree (minimum).
	At least 3 years of working experience in a position with similar tasks, ideally in higher education.
	Excellent communication and writing skills in English.
	Outstanding financial and analytical skills.
	An interest in working on finance and HR-related tasks in an international environment.
	High level computer literacy and advanced knowledge of the MS Office suite and mastery of databases.
	Discretion when dealing with sensitive/confidential information.
	Ability to work in a team and to complete tasks independently and under pressure
	Excellent organizational and reporting skills.
	Structured and flexible way of thinking.
	A precise, proactive and efficient attitude and work ethics.
	Great attention to detail.
	Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and take initiative.
	Ability to follow instructions and meet deadlines.
	Ability to understand and learn new tasks quickly.
	Experience in marketing/branding/social media and German language knowledge are considered as an advantage.	 What we offer 	International environment
	Salary supplement for meals
	Employer contributions to Resaver private pension plan
	Family support scheme
	In-house opportunities for job related trainings and workshops	 We offer a competitive salary starting from gross 42,000 EUR/year (prorated). A higher salary is possible if warranted by the candidate’s working experience. HOW TO APPLY Applicants need to submit: 	CV
	Cover letter Please send your complete application package to advert100@ceu.edu: including the job code in the subject line: 2022/100 CEU is strongly committed to the promotion of gender equality and equal opportunities within our institution. Previous training, work experience and/or engagement with matters of equality, diversity and inclusion at the organizational level will be an asset. Central European University does not discriminate on the basis of—including, but not limited to—race, color, national and ethnic origin, religion, gender and sexual orientation in administering its educational policies, admissions policies, employment, scholarship and loan programs, and athletic and other school-administered programs.
The privacy of your personal information is very important to us. We collect, use, and store your personal information in accordance with the requirements of the applicable data privacy rules, including specifically the General Data Protection Regulation. To learn more about how we manage your personal data during the recruitment process, please see our Privacy Notice at: https://www.ceu.edu/recruitment-privacy-notice-austria. About CEU Central European University (CEU) is a research-intensive university specializing in the social sciences, humanities, law, public policy and management. It is accredited in the United States, Austria, and Hungary. CEU’s mission is to promote academic excellence, state-of-the-art research, research-based teaching and learning and civic engagement, in order to contribute to the development of open societies. CEU offers bachelor's, master’s and doctoral programs and enrolls more than 1,400 students from over 100 countries. The teaching staff consists of resident faculty from over 50 countries and prominent visiting scholars from around the world. The language of instruction is English.
For more information, please visit https://www.ceu.edu/.

title: Part-Time Administrative Project Coordinator (f/m/d) Department of Public Policy bei CEU GmbH – CEU Central European University Private University | karriere.at
text:
Part-Time Administrative Project Coordinator (f/m/d)
Department of Public Policy Starting date: March 1, 2023 Application deadline: Open until filled Full- or Part-Time: Part-Time (20 hours/week) Location: Vienna The Central European University (CEU) invites applications for a Part-Time (20 hours/week) Administrative Project Coordinator position at the Department of Public Policy (DPP) at the Vienna Campus. DPP is a multi-disciplinary graduate institution committed to the values of open society and creating strong and flexible links between research and practice as one way of responding to what is, overall, a failure of policy elites to tackle the most urgent problems of our time. The Department offers four master's degrees in public policy, and the public policy track of the Doctor of Philosophy in Political Science program. The degree programs are tailored for students from around the world seeking careers in the public, private, and not-for-profit sectors at the local, national, European Union and international levels. The Department boasts a team of outstanding resident faculty, world-class visiting faculty made up of top researchers, and practitioners in the public policy field who bring a wide array of academic and practical subjects to DPP's diverse classroom. The Department has built strategic partnerships with policy actors across the globe while deepening cooperation with the Open Society Foundations and its networks such as OSUN and CIVICA, within which it is launching new collaborative programs. The new colleague will primarily support these new OSUN and CIVICA programs. Your duties and responsibilities: 	General projects coordination and support
	Liaise with CEU administrative units, such as HR and Finance regarding all administrative matters related to the projects e.g., contracting, invoicing and purchase orders
	Coordinate the admissions process for project participants
	Organize project events, and project-related meetings for partners and stakeholders
	Liaison with OSUN and CIVICA partner institutions on joint affairs
	Keep the projects guides and websites up to date
	Perform data collection, analysis and reporting to the Project Leaders and the Head of Department and faculty Your skills and qualifications: 	Bachelor’s degree (minimum)
	At least 3 years of working experience in a position with similar tasks, ideally in higher education
	High level computer literacy and advanced knowledge of the MS Office suite
	Financial skills for budgeting and reporting
	Excellent communication and writing skills in English
	Good organizational and interpersonal skills
	Ability to balance sensitivity towards project stakeholders needs with ensuring project adherence to university policies and guidelines
	Multicultural orientation and open-mindedness	 What we offer We offer a competitive salary starting from gross 40,000 EUR/year (prorated). A higher salary is possible if warranted by the candidate’s working experience. The initial contract is for one year with the possibility of renewal. How to apply: Applicants need to submit:
CV
	Cover letter Please send your complete application package to: advert004@ceu.edu - including job code in subject line: 2023/004. CEU is strongly committed to the promotion of gender equality and equal opportunities within our institution. Previous training, work experience and/or engagement with matters of equality, diversity and inclusion at the organizational level will be an asset. Central European University does not discriminate on the basis of—including, but not limited to—race, color, national and ethnic origin, religion, gender and sexual orientation in administering its educational policies, admissions policies, employment, scholarship and loan programs, and athletic and other school-administered programs. The privacy of your personal information is very important to us. We collect, use, and store your personal information in accordance with the requirements of the applicable data privacy rules, including specifically the General Data Protection Regulation. To learn more about how we manage your personal data during the recruitment process, please see our Privacy Notice at: https://www.ceu.edu/recruitment-privacy-notice-austria ( Austria: Central European University, CEU Central European University Private University). CEU is an equal opportunity employer. About CEU Central European University (CEU) is a graduate research-intensive university specializing in the social sciences, humanities, law, public policy and management. It is accredited in the United States, Austria and Hungary. CEU’s mission is to promote academic excellence, state-of-the-art research, research-based teaching and learning and civic engagement, in order to contribute to the development of open societies in Central and Eastern Europe, the former Soviet Union, and other emerging democracies throughout the world. CEU offers both master’s and doctoral programs and enrolls more than 1,400 students from over 100 countries. The teaching staff consists of more than 180 resident faculty from over 50 countries and a large number of prominent visiting scholars from around the world. The language of instruction is English.
For more information, please visit https://www.ceu.edu/.

title: Financial Analyst & R&D Controller (f/m/div)* bei Infineon Technologies Austria AG | karriere.at
text:
Financial Analyst & R&D Controller (f/m/div)* At a glanceFinancial Analysts ensure that Infineon makes sound financial decisions and effectively manages its portfolio of R&D projects. In this role, your work, whether it’s creating relevant financial analysis or managing all aspects of R&D cost controlling, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. You will work directly with our R&D Heads, Project Managers and Product-line Heads and provide full financial support. Quick infoLocationVillachEntry level3-5 yearsJob IDHRC0143659Startas soon as possibleTypeFull timeContractPermanent
Job descriptionIn your new job you will: Be responsible for the overall financial controlling of R&D spending and act as a business partner to our R&D management Support the global R&D organization, especially the program & project management team in the planning and execution of R&D projects Collaborate with the diverse global business unit teams to increase transparency of actual vs forecast spending as well as milestone achievement on a project level Define, create and present R&D dashboards with financial summaries and business insights to the leadership team to help understand the drivers of financial performance Support a high quality and reliable financial forecast and long-term planning with underlying data analytics, in close cooperation with the head of financial controlling, to ensure optimum operations effectiveness Conduct internal and external benchmarks to identify areas for further improvement Perform all relevant financial controlling tasks including monthly and quarterly closing activities Develop scalable and efficient financial processes to support different business needs and models ProfileYou are self-motivated and have a strong capability to independently leverage and drive our R&D controlling. You are proactive and a fast learner with strong work ethics who is passionate about driving the growth and evolution of the DCDC business. As a master juggler working on multiple topics at a time, you are focused on details while finding efficient ways to take on big picture challenges. Your excellent interpersonal and communication skills lead to effective collaboration across different locations, cultures and time zones.You are best equipped for this task if you have: An academic degree in Finance, Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics or equivalent 2+ years of work experience in the field of business analytics Strong understanding of data collection, aggregation and summarization to enable best practices for decision making Hands-on experience in creating visualizations to aid in understanding data Knowledge about ERP applications comprising SAP (or equivalent) and demonstrated ability to quickly learn internal business intelligence systems Data analytics skills (i.e. Power BI, R, or Python) and basic accounting skills (e.g. capitalization under IFRS) are preferred Excellent English skills, additional German skills or the willingness to learn is a plus We offer competitive salaries and additional benefits based on your performance, experience and qualification. When staffed in Austria, this position is subject to the collective agreement for workers and employees in the electrical and electronics industry, employment group G (https://www.feei.at/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/minimum-salaries-white-collar-workers-2022.pdf). A higher payment is negotiable depending on your expertise and skills. About UsPart of your life. Part of tomorrow.Infineon is a world leader in semiconductor solutions that make life easier, safer, and greener. Our solutions for efficient energy management, smart mobility, and secure, seamless communications link the real and the digital world.–Power & Sensor Systems (PSS) drives leading-edge power management, sensing and data transfer capabilities –Infineon PSS semiconductors play a vital role in enabling intelligent power management, smart sensitivity as well as fast and reliable data processing in an increasingly digitalized world. Our leading-edge power devices make chargers, adapters, power tools and lighting systems smarter, smaller, lighter and more energy-efficient. Our trusted sensors increase the context sensitivity of “things” and systems such as HMI, and our RF chips power fast and reliable data communication.At Infineon in Villach you shape the technologies of tomorrow and work in an international environment with more than 3900 colleagues from over 70 nations. Your personal contribution will be valued and appreciated as the cornerstones of our success. And all that in beautiful surroundings which guarantee a high quality of life.The City of Villach is located in the center of Carinthia, Austria’s southernmost province, in close proximity to the Italian and Slovenian border. Due to its particular geographic location and the outstanding natural beauty of the region, Villach and the whole province of Carinthia have for generations been popular holiday destinations for people from all over the world. Living in Austria also has many social, health-care-related and economic perks. The country’s social and health care system is among the best in the world and for decades numerous international surveys have singled out Austria as a particularly safe and wealthy country with a high quality of life. Villach benefits from its status as a “small town”, offering everyday living at affordable prices in an outstanding setting.Find out what you like most about Villach and join us:https://www.welcome2villach.at/* The term gender in the sense of the General Equal Treatment Act (GETA) or other national legislation refers to the biological assignment to a gender group. At Infineon we are proud to embrace (gender) diversity, including female, male and diverse. Contact UsManuel KrebsTalent Attraction Manager Apply now

Please find further information on our website: http://www.voestalpine.com/highperformancemetals/en/ Job description Take ownership for the global core products master data model and its dependencies Actively drive the professional maintenance and continuous development of core products master data for SAP and connected systems to support business goals Play an active role in standardisation and harmonisation of core products master data in the group, in close collaboration with business and other functions Proactively monitor master data quality and drive improvement activities with subsidiaries globally Ensure and deliver trainings on core products master data for colleagues (m/f/d) globally Take over responsibilities in the regular lifecycle management process of core products master data Act as expert (m/f/d) for core products master data further rollouts of new SAP globally, to integrate existing and new requirements into a consistent solution Qualifications Several years of experience in business or IT functions, actively managing SAP and/or other master data Excellent communication skills, successful management of conflicting interests with multiple functions and ability to finding solutions for business requirements collaboratively High service-orientation and getting-things-done mentality towards internal customers Reliability and diligence, as well as self-organised personality Advanced level of German and English, other languages are beneficial Flexibility to travel globally (up to 15%) Possibility for home office up to 2 days a week What we offer Salary Package and Benefits: The collective minimum salary agreement for this position is € 3.491,24 gross (14 x per year). The actual payment depends on the particular qualification and experience. voestalpine offers its workforce an attractive and appreciative working environment: We support with an extensive initial introduction phase, regular on – the – job trainings, flexible working hours and annual appraisal interviews. We enable certain perquisites and benefits for different commercial partners and with a good course of business all employees will be paid an additional annual bonus. Employee participation is of particular importance for us; currently employees of voestalpine hold 14% of the shares. The fact that voestalpine is a globally leading steel and technology group today is primarily thanks to its approximately 50,200 employees. We are constantly working to create a modern working environment that values diversity, equal opportunities and the joy of innovation. We are looking forward to receive your application. More information about our application process can be found on the first page of our application form and in the “FAQs to apply”.Please be aware that benefits may vary depending on location. Current information in handling COVID- 19: Initial interviews in the application process are held via WebEx and/or by telephone. Final interviews will be held in accordance with the necessary COVID-19 regulations in person and on site. The induction phase will take place in the company. Employee participation Employee bonuses Company pension Employee benefits Cafeteria Healthy nutrition Sports and fitness programs Health measures Parking space Good transportation access Barrier-free workplace Company cell phone Company laptop Training and education Home office Employee events Flexible work hours Employee participation; Employee bonuses; Company pension; Employee benefits; Cafeteria; Healthy nutrition; Sports and fitness programs; Health measures; Parking space; Good transportation access; Barrier-free workplace; Company cell phone; Company laptop; Training and education; Home office; Employee events; Flexible work hours Video Contact & Application Recruiter: Sandra Fröhlich+43 50304 15 73890 Hiring Manager: Martin Heindl+43 50304 10 22526 Awards Jetzt online bewerben

title: Student Job (f/m/x) - Advanced Analytics Tribe – Community Communication Support (25h/week) bei Raiffeisen Bank International AG | karriere.at
text: Student Job (f/m/x) - Advanced Analytics Tribe – Community Communication Support (25h/week) Advanced Analytics Tribe is looking for a Student Support. You’re in the middle of your studies and you think: I’d like to get some hands-on experience. It would be good to work with top experienced colleagues in the area of Advanced Analytics. Here new products of the finance world are born! This is a top challenge to get practical experience and to polish up your CV– or your bank balance, for that matter. If this sounds like you, then send an application and get to know the international world of banking. #start as soon as possible #part-time (25h / week) #viennaoffice These tasks are waiting for you Assist in promoting our innovations and use cases during events, roadshows and conferences Support to craft and send regular newsletters with updates and promotions Support to continuously develop and monitor our department online and social media channels Network with industry experts and potential business counterparts to drive awareness Manage meetings, workshops and webinars Collect and analyze feedback Create and polish our presentations, videos and content This job is made for you, if... you are actively enrolled in an ongoing studies (preferably Marketing Communications in the middle of bachelor or beginning of master), remaining studying time minimum 18 months you have first experience with (web) content creation as well as marketing campaigns or workshop organization you have good knowledge of marketing techniques you have high interest in Data Science and Cloud Environments (Knowledge is an advantage) you have knowledge of MS Office applications (Excel, Pivot Tables, Power Point …) you have a very good knowledge of English (German is an advantage) Does the following apply to you as well? You have excellent verbal and written communication skills You have a high level of self-organization and a structured way of working What's in it for you? Work & Study: gain experience in the international banking environment & boost the balance of your bank account Flexibility: adapt your working hours to your university schedule and balance on-site and home-office days Onboarding: enjoy an easy start - a buddy from your team will take you along Community: network internally with other students Canteen: healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized Corporate Benefits: shopping vouchers from the staffs' council (eg. supermarkets), free museum tickets, attractive sports offers, reduced fitness center membership, free public transport pass etc. We pay an attractive monthly student salary of gross EUR 2,049.64 (on a basis of 38.5 hours) Would you like to know what it feels like working for RBI while studying? Check out our videos and see what your future colleagues say about us. At Raiffeisen Bank International, we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people. From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. title: (Junior) Legal Counsel - Media and Marketing bei Red Bull GmbH | karriere.at
text: Full-time	 (Junior) Legal Counsel - Media and Marketing Elsbethen, Austria Apply now Are you a motivated and proactive team player with a service-oriented and structured way of working? Become part of the Marketing and Media Legal Team Coordinate, manage and advise on all legal matters in relation to the development, production and distribution of content including feature films. Advise on partnerships with sponsors, streaming platforms, television networks and Hollywood production companies. Support in organizational and administrative matters including rights management. RESPONSIBILITIES Areas that play to your strengths All the responsibilities we'll trust you with: LEGAL ADVICEIn this exciting position, you’ll support the management and legal team in all legal questions in connection with media, marketing and feature film related topics. You’ll advise management and legal team on sponsorship agreements, commercial partnerships and athlete/sports team agreements. You’ll assist and give advice to management in all legal questions arising during acquisition, live/non live production and distribution of content relating to Red Bull events and third-party events. In addition, you’ll guide on Union/Guild issues and film/TV finance including tax credit issues.On key topics e.g. strategic priorities, business planning, legal templates and high-level risk assessment you’ll align with Head of Legal. TRAININGS, TEMPLATES AND RIGHTS MANAGEMENTYou’ll draft and implement templates for core contracts and provide training to the business on how to implement and key legal “watch outs.” Furthermore, you’ll assist with administrative tasks and “back end” requirements such as rights management systems. DRAFT, REVIEW AND FINALIZE AGREEMENTSYou’ll advise on, draft, review and finalize international film, TV, format development and online agreements, e.g. production service agreements, co-production agreements, license and distribution agreements, commercial cooperation agreements. Typical counterparts will be international film/TV production companies, international TV channels and global streaming platforms. Experience Your areas of knowledge and expertise That matter most for this role: 1-4 years Post-Qualified Experience (preferred) in a top tier law firm (with marketing and/or media focus), international film or TV production/distribution company, broadcaster, sports agency or sports federation or similar Familiar with drafting, revising, and negotiating media related contracts in English Excellent knowledge of copyright and media law Good knowledge of international business standards in the media and advertising industry Experience of working with other jurisdictions especially US or UK or EU A motivated team player with a well-structured and precise way of working and service oriented can-do attitude Ability to prioritize, solve problems and provide business solutions to legal issues in a fast-paced environment European or Commonwealth law degree; If German law degree, I. and II. State Exam (“Volljurist”); at least one with excellence “Prädikat”. In Austria, attorney at law exam is of advantage. If English, US, New Zealand or Australian law qualification – we require you to be a qualified and practicing solicitor or barrister or admitted to the New York or California Bar. Advanced professional education in copyright and media law e.g. LL.M is an advantage. In Germany: “Fachanwaltskurs für Urheber- und Medienrecht” is a plus. Fluent in English; German language skills are an advantage 0-10 JOIN THE TEAM Got what it takes? In your application we want to see your personal style - what makes you tick and why you think your next opportunity is here with us. Apply now Due to legal reasons we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is EUR 2,181 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary. As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin.

title: Internship Project Management (all genders) #work&study #agile #projectmanagement #addvalue bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text: We are part of Erste Group – the largest banking group in Central and Eastern Europe with more than 2,500 branches and over 45,000 employees. Our more than 2,000 IT experts and enthusiasts are the bank's Digital Muscle. Internship Project Management (all genders) #work&study #agile #projectmanagement #addvalue Location: Vienna Working-Hours: Full-time Occupation Area: IT Company: Erste Digital With top notch technology, we drive the realization offers the Group’s vision: To provide human banking in digital times, and to build Financial Health for over 16 million customers in the CEE region. We aim to attract and develop the best talent and aspire to be an IT employer beyond compare. We are Erste Digital. We are #digitaltotheheart This position is within the risk management area, more specifically we are responsible for loan application and risk steering functionalities. Thus, we are direct contributors to Erste’s mission on fostering financial health for everybody in our region. Apart from seeing a direct impact in our everyday work, the team is driving the ambition towards digitalization in Erste Bank and Sparkassen. After your internship you learned in practice how to structure problems and take action to solve them. In addition, this position is also going to help you to communicate effectively with all audiences in a structured manner. What is more, is the development and strengths of your working style and personal values. What to do: Prepare meetings, including gathering of additional information, conducting analysis, presenting arguments, making sense of complex documents, understanding perspectives of involved stakeholders Organize a smooth daily work routine (e. g. appointments) and support the team in overseeing finance and controlling topics Drive selected initiatives and events on behalf of the department Ensure that documents and information meet high quality standards, can be easily understood, and contain all necessary and relevant information Support in maintaining the regular communication with key stakeholders Assist with data administration, e-mails, and other communication You check these boxes: Enrolled Master’s student with on-going program at university (Uni, FH) Self-management and time management Empathy and trustworthiness Strategic and growth mindset, with a flavor of humor Analytical skills and an eye for details Knowledge of IT and/ or lending products or the curiousness to grow further in one of the areas Appreciative communication and passion for teamwork and continuous learning Fluent in English and German Why you will like us: Possibility to benefit and learn from our international, talented and passionate community at Erste. Great learning curve through ownership and creative freedom. Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic. Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there’s something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus. Health Centre – The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health centre that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours. New way of work: With our flexible working hours model we want to make your life less complicated. Combing the best of both worlds, remote and company time. Discover all our benefits of Erste group here - Thanks to our corporate benefits partners, you can also receive a whole bunch of discounts in different areas. We offer you a varied part-time internship position (20-30h/week) for 12 months. An internship salary of EUR 2.854,-- gross per month (on a full-time basis) is offered. Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Apply online Follow us:

title: (Senior-) Underwriter I Casualty CSEE (m/w/d) bei AXA XL Austria & CSEE (Standort Wien) | karriere.at
text:
(Senior-) Underwriter I Casualty CSEE (m/w/d) Permanent position, full time (38,5h per week) in Vienna, Austria DISCOVER your opportunity What will your essential responsibilities include?
Profit-oriented underwriting of liability risks and detailed analysis of risks in the CSEE region with a focus on Turkey, Israel and Greece
Management of own portfolio with support of monitoring tools, Portfolio maintenance and upkeep
Customized conception of insurance contracts and facultative reinsurance agreements in English
Customer-oriented processing of business, maintenance and expansion of existing customer relationships as well as active development of new customer relationships
Control of loss trends, initiation/implementation and control of recovery measures
Collaboration in product development
Observation of changes in the relevant legal environment
Cooperation and close exchange with Casualty's international colleagues
Cooperation with Client and Distribution Management and involved underwriters of other lines of business
Cooperation with AXA XL colleagues worldwide
Participation in trainings and other qualification measures
(Expert) Presentation delivery
Independently gather and evaluate information on special events in the field of work that are of interest in terms of new business, portfolio, organization and competition.
You will be reporting to the Underwriting Manager Casualty CSEE, based in Vienna.
SHARE your talent
We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
University or technical college degree or comparable qualification
Experience in the Southern / Eastern European insurance market an advantage
Experience in coordination and management of international insurance programs and facultative reinsurance business
Experience in international facultative Underwriting
Fluent in written and spoken English (B2+). Other languages from the Southern / Eastern European region an advantage.
Sales orientation and negotiation skills
Conceptual strength and organizational skills
Ability to work in a team & awareness of interculturality
Experience in project management
Very good MS Office skills
Willingness to travel.
FIND your future
AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it. How? By combining a strong and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business − property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty. With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward. Learn more at axaxl.com
Corporate Responsibility
At AXA XL our approach to corporate responsibility (CR) is the same as our approach to business; constantly seeking to provide innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. From offering our expertise, products, and services to help build more resilient communities, to advancing understanding and response to climate change, our strategy – Our Impact. Our Future. – aligns key issues that are pertinent to our business – climate, water and financial resilience - and contributes to AXA Group’s purpose to “Act for human progress by protecting what matters”. Climate: We’re reducing our carbon footprint, protecting ecosystems and exploring how our business can help build a better world.
Water: We’re developing water resilience where it is — and will be — needed most.
Financial resilience: We’re helping create opportunities for the unemployed and underemployed, so they can be better prepared for unexpected changes.
Hearts in Action: We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as our “Hearts in Action” programs. For more information, please see the Corporate Responsibility section on our website. Inclusion & Diversity
We know that a diverse workforce and inclusive culture enable business growth and are critical to our success. That’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attracting and retaining the most diverse workforce possible, while creating a strong, inclusive culture where everyone is welcome and can contribute and reach their highest potential. Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index – 2017, 2018
Signatory to the CEO Action for Diversity
Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter
Twelve Colleague Resource Groups around the Globe
Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
Enhanced family friendly leave benefits Our Benefits
We offer an attractive international working environment with a secure, socially committed, and fair employer
We embrace different family forms and offer generous leave arrangements (e.g. paternity leave) to ensure that our employees can spend the necessary time with their families on important occasions
We are committed to work-life balance and offer the opportunity to work not only in the office but also from home
We offer an attractive company pension plan as well as other benefits in the personal insurance area and company medical care
We offer the option to purchase company shares at preferential conditions
We offer many different opportunities for personal and professional development.
Work at AXA XL! For this position, we offer a minimum gross salary of EUR 50,000,00 per year with willingness to increase based on appropriate qualifications and experience. Interested? We look forward to receiving your application to karriere@axaxl.com.

text:
brutkasten ist das Leitmedium des deutschsprachigen Innovations-Ökosystems mit Sitz in Wien, München und Berlin.
